content.description:
A really, really fun jug haul up a steepening section of the wall, with an intimidating roof near the top.

Start on a foot-wide ledge below the first bolt and head up on less-than-vertical rock using positive edges (and one pocket) through three bolts to a bit of a ledge. Continue up the now steepening, blocky section using mostly jugs (occasionally juggy sidepulls). Wonder a time or two if the jugs are going to stay attached to the wall.

Arrive under the roof, take a breath, and haul your corpus upward.

At the second bolt above the roof (the last, and tenth overall) head up and right to the chains (the chains can't be seen from the last bolt—they are over the bulging section of rock at the top that is to the right of the bolt line ).
content.protection: 10 bolts, chain anchors. Chains can't be seen from the ground.
content.location:
The first route west (left) past the large boulders that delimit the left of the cave area.

Has an obvious, three-foot-by-two-foot roof near the top.

content.description:
An exciting line that runs up just to the left of a thin prow.

A delicate move or two to the first bolt, then some careful foot work to the second (don't fall clipping the second boltyou'll deck). Arete trickery for a bit, then left onto the face left of the arete, following the good pockets to the chains.
content.location:
The far left line at

The Bone Cave

area.  Walk past the cave, around (or through) the boulders, past Screaming Skeleton and follow the wall west until you see it. (It's about 100 yards past screaming Skeleton.  The line is fairly easy to find; it runs up a prow that arises just before the trail along the base of the wall starts steeply downhill to the left

content.description:
Easy climbing on first 3 bolts. Crux is a well defined middle section  with about 5 moves then eases up to 5.10 climbing.

The route is pretty steep and fun.
content.location: Furthest right route outside of the cave. To the right of Cross Bones.

content.description:
A tricky, balancy start to an

I-hope-this-doesn't-fall-off

flake followed by a concentration-inducing, shallow dihedral.

Atop the dihedral the crux awaits: a slightly more than vertical section with sidepulls and non-existent feet.

Going left and following the larger, more logical holds at the penultimate bolt keeps the rating down in the .11 range.
content.location:
Near the left side of the wall that is to the left of

The Bone Cave

proper. The line starts from a flat-ish area just left of a medium-sized evergreen tree.

content.description:
Steep climbing on good holds. Very consistent from bottom to top. Crux can be found near the middle.

Can't quite call it 12d but very solid at 12c.

Surprisingly solid rock but as always,  wear a helmet!
content.location: Second route in on the right side of cave.

content.description:
Bouldery start leads to a great ledge. Steep climbing on positive crimps, sidepulls and jugs.  Glory knee bar around the 3rd bolt. Kinda chossy rock up to janky open ended anchors.

Steep, fun and moderately good.
content.protection: Bolts to janky open ended anchors.
